mil3.5.10:0.1_0: The Simile of the Making Hand
mil3.5.10:0.3_0: and taking care of the Buddha’s presence.
mil3.5.10:1.4_0: “But sir, can you point out a Nāgadatta here who does so that
mil3.5.10:1.5_0: “Great king, the Buddha has become fully extinguished through the natural principle of extinguishment, without anything left over. He can’t always tell him that ‘This is possible.’”
mil3.5.10:2.2_0: “What do you think, great king? Would the fire produced by old age, set up a big transmission?”
mil3.5.10:2.3_0: “So it’s not understood who has ceased and ended.”
mil3.5.10:2.4_0: “In the same way, the Buddha has become fully extinguished through the natural principle of extinguishment, without anything left over, it’s possible to address the teaching, or to anyone else.
mil3.5.10:2.5_0: For the teaching is taught by the Buddha.”
mil3.5.10:5.1_0: The fifth sub-chapter on the Buddha is finished.
mil3.5.10:6.1_0: and the ten questions on this exposition of the teaching.
